Navigation
Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Number/min

Synopsis Determine the smallest of two numeric values.
Function &T <: num min(&T <: num n, &T <: num m)
Description The smallest of two numbers. The type of the result is the same as the type of the smallest argument.
Examples 
rascal>import Number;
ok
rascal>min(12, 13);
int: 12
rascal>min(12, -13);
int: -13
rascal>min(3.14, 4);
num: 3.14
Questions
Question 1.
The type of min(-7, 18) is

Question 2.
The type of min(-13, 19.15360489880258400) is

Question 3.
The type of min(-19.7171783179293136400, -15.10299319342376400) is

Question 4. 
min(2, 13.71156596331195600) ==
